column2: A violent revolt has broken out in $PROV$. Unsatisfied with the current situation, the local commoners have taken to arms.
Minor Revolt
Serious Revolt
Massive Revolt
Revolt Suppressed
Reduced Taxes
Rebels Offer Rejected
Recent Revolt

A violent revolt has broken out in [Root.GetName].\nUnsatisfied with the current situation and determined to fight against my 'oppressive' rule, the local commoners have taken to arms.\nI should probably send [Root.County.Holder.job_marshal.GetTitledName] to contain the uprising.
How dare they oppose me!

A violent revolt has broken out in [Root.GetName].\nUnsatisfied with the current situation and determined to fight against my 'oppressive' rule, the local commoners have taken to arms.\nIt is time to find a good marshal, I need to send someone to contain the uprising.
How dare they oppose me!

A violent revolt has broken out in [From.GetName].\nAngered by the oppressive rule of [From.County.Holder.GetTitledName], the local commoners have taken to arms. Unfortunately, their indiscriminate destruction will affect our holdings as well...
If the local lord doesn't act, I better...
The peasant revolters ravaging the province of [Root.GetName] have burnt down a building.
Is there anything they won't destroy?
Bad news, but I am glad it didn't happen to my holdings...
The peasant revolters ravaging the province of [From.GetName] have burnt down a building.
I have been attacked by the peasant revolters in [Root.Location.GetName]!
They killed me?!
These rebels must be stopped!
I am lucky to be alive...
[From.GetTitledName] has been captured and killed by the peasant revolters ravaging our lands.
How dare they execute a subject of mine?

My liege,
I was ambushed by a mob of peasant rebels and barely got away with my life. The attack has left my maimed and I fear for the life of me and those around me in [From.Location.GetName]. These rebels must be stopped.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
They sure do...

My liege,
Although I escaped with my life, the mob of peasant rebels that attacked me managed to wound me. I fear these attacks will only increase until the revolt in [From.Location.GetName] is put down.
Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
This peasant rabble must be stopped!
Feeling little loyalty to the far off ruler of [Root.Holder.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName], the peasant rebels of [Root.GetName] have defected and sworn allegiance to another ruler!
Tired of their old ruler, the peasant rebels of [Root.GetName] have defected and sworn allegiance to me!
Excellent! Or is it...?

Feeling little loyalty to the far off ruler of [FromFrom.Holder.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetName], the peasant rebels of [FromFrom.GetName] have defected and sworn allegiance to [From.County.Holder.GetTitledName]!
This is unacceptable!
Outrages!
$PROVINCENAME$ is isolated from the rest of the realm. It is difficult to control.
We will have to do something about this...
$PROVINCENAME$ is no longer isolated.
Good.
The peasant revolters ravaging the province of $PROVINCENAME$ will agree to depose arms if you reduce their current taxes.
Very well.
I will not do this!
Revolt Suppressed
I arrived to [Root.Location.GetName] and managed to find and arrest the local revolt leaders. Without them, the peasants will not dare to oppose my liege any more...
Excellent. They learned their lesson.
Send a letter to my liege
My liege, I managed to find and arrest the local revolt leaders in [From.Location.GetName]. Without them, the peasants will not dare to oppose you any more.
Excellent!
If my liege doesn't act, I better...
Peasant revolters have taken control of one of our holdings in [From.GetName] and declared independence!
The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has been restored, but no rightful king sits on its throne. It is time to find a suitable claimant to truly complete the restoration.
We will find the rightful king and restore him to the throne.
Searches for a strong claimant to restore the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] to its former glory have come up empty. Perhaps we should begin to look for claimants who are somewhat less suitable?
We will widen our search for the rightful king.
Searches for a claimant to the throne of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] have once more come up empty. Perhaps we should widen up the search even more?
Any native claimant will be good enough for the throne.

After an uprising against foreign conquerors, the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has been restored and regained its independence. As a rightful [Root.Culture.GetName] [Root.Religion.GetName] claimant for the throne of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you have been offered the crown of the newly liberated kingdom.
I will reclaim my birthright as the King of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
I have no interest in pursuing such a claim.

Despite your best efforts, no suitable claimants to the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] have come up. As the liberator of the kingdom, the people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are beginning to look to you as the rightful king.
If there is no one else, I will lead the kingdom to glory.
[Root.Culture.GetName] rebels have risen up in [Root.GetName], led by a group of disgruntled nobles. If not swiftly crushed, this revolt could spread like wildfire!
Curses!
[From.Culture.GetName] rebels have risen up in [From.GetName], led by a group of disgruntled nobles. If not swiftly crushed, this revolt could spread like wildfire!
Curses!
Another raving mob of [Root.Culture.GetName] rebels have risen up in [Root.GetName], reinforcing the ongoing uprising!
Another raving mob of [From.Culture.GetName] rebels have risen up in [From.GetName], reinforcing the ongoing uprising!

The people of [From.GetName] resent what they see as our foreign rule over the province. Hostility has sprung up against our garrisons and administrators, and the rugged terrain means that it is difficult to properly exert our authority. Even with our best efforts we should not expect resistance to our rule to go away quietly anytime soon.
Ungrateful scum...

§RRemote Provinces§! deep in the mountains or hidden behind dense forests are difficult to properly control and tend to be quite hostile to foreign lords trying to enforce their rule over the region. These provinces are restless and difficult to control - even a minor disturbance or rebellion can rapidly escalate into a dangerous §RMajor Revolt§! spreading across the entire region, if not quickly brought under control. Remote Province modifiers can be decreased and eventually removed by taking the §YPacification§! title decision, and can also be handled in the short term by granting the provinces to vassals of the §Ylocal culture§! or establishing §YMarcher Lords§!.
Stop bothering me about this nonsense!
You will no longer receive notifications about Remote Provinces.

The revolt in [revolt_target.GetName] is gaining momentum. Never fully pacified, the neighbouring provinces are quickly growing agitated at this apparent sign of weakness, and our tenuous control over the region is threatening to falter. If we cannot contain this local rebellion soon, we may soon have a much larger problem on our hands...

The revolt in [revolt_target.GetName] is gaining momentum. Never fully pacified, the neighbouring provinces are quickly growing agitated at this apparent sign of weakness, and our officials have noticed similar sentiments growing in some of our lands. If this rebellion is not contained soon, we may soon have a large problem on our hands...

The revolt in [revolt_target.GetName] is gaining momentum. Never fully pacified, the neighbouring provinces are quickly growing agitated at this apparent sign of weakness, and our tenuous control over the region is threatening to falter. If this rebellion is not contained soon, we may soon have a much larger problem on our hands...

The revolt in [revolt_target.GetName] is gaining momentum. Never fully pacified, the neighbouring provinces are quickly growing agitated at this apparent sign of weakness, and our suzerain's tenuous control over the region is threatening to falter. If this rebellion is not contained soon, this could be an excellent opportunity to throw off the [current_suzerain.Culture.GetName] yoke...
Rally our forces!
If the revolt reaches a warscore of §Y50%§!, a §RMajor Revolt§! will break out!
This is most worrying.
We may soon need to intervene...
Promising news.
If the revolt reaches a warscore of §Y50%§!, a §YMajor Revolt§! will break out, offering us the opportunity to rebel during their moment of distraction.
And why do I care about this rabble?
You will no longer receive warnings about potential Major Revolts.
[Root.GetLocalResistanceRegionAdjective] Liberation Revolt
[nationalist_revolt_target_province.GetLocalResistanceRegion] Revolts!

A massive revolt has broken out in [nationalist_revolt_target_province.GetLocalResistanceRegion]! Led by [From.GetTitledName], a large number of disgruntled [nationalist_revolt_target_province.Culture.GetName] nobles and warriors have gathered to rise up against our rule, supported by disloyal vassals and ambitious lords beyond our borders. If we do not move quickly, we could rapidly lose control of the entire region!
Curses!
